title: Microsoft reveals Azure Space Partner Community
summary: Microsoft is expanding its relationships with space companies through the Azure Space Partner Community, an initiative unveiled July 19 at the Microsoft Inspire 2022 conference.

title: Two companies join SpaceX in the race to Mars, with a launch possible in 2024
summary: "If it wasn't challenging, I wouldn't be doing it."

title: Relativity to launch Impulse Space’s Mars Lander as early as 2024
summary: Impulse Space has announced that the company will launch the first commercial payload to Mars on board Relativity Space’s Terran R rocket. Under the new partnership, Relativity will launch Impulse’s Mars Cruise Vehicle and Mars Lander from Cape Canaveral, Florida, as part of an exclusive agreement until 2029.

title: NASA delays VIPER lunar rover launch by a year
summary: NASA has delayed the launch of an ice-prospecting lunar rover by a year to perform more testing of its commercial lander, the agency announced July 18.

title: The Great British Lift-Off
summary: The countdown for the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom is underway. The latest developments.

title: DirecTV says 5G plan would degrade satellite TV reception
summary: DirecTV said July 18 its satellite TV customers face major disruption if broadcast rival Dish Network gets to deploy 5G wireless services in the 12 GHz spectrum band.

title: Northrop Grumman taps Solstar for HALO Module Wi-Fi
summary: Solstar Space will provide Wi-Fi access for crew and devices in NASA’s Habitation and Logistics Outpost module, under a contract the New Mexico in-orbit communications startup signed with Northrop Grumman Corp.

title: L3Harris, Northrop Grumman to build 28 missile-tracking satellites for U.S. Space Development Agency
summary: The Space Development Agency awarded contracts to L3Harris Technologies and Northrop Grumman to each build 14 missile-tracking satellites.

title: As Webb begins observing exoplanets, scientists use Spitzer data & brown dwarfs to reveal how silicate clouds form
summary: In a new study from a group of researchers in Canada, data from NASA’s now-retired Spitzer Space Telescope was used to determine the conditions under which silicate clouds form on distant exoplanets outside of our solar system — giving scientists insight into what’s inside the atmospheres of exoplanets similar in size, temperature, and composition to Earth.

title: SpaceX is now launching 10 rockets for every one by its main competitor
summary: In the meantime, SpaceX continues to build a massive launch tower in Florida.
